DataElement.preferredName: Patient Lung Pathologic N Stage Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the status of a patient's lung pathologic N stage in relation to clinical trial eligibility.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Lung Pathologic N Stage Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to lung (the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place) pathologic (caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology) N stage (N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement) and determining whether a patient/participant is suitable for enrollment in a study according to protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Lung Pathologic N Stage Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has but two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border. SYN pulmo.:Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: One of a pair of viscera occupying the pulmonary cavities of the thorax, the organs of respiration in which aeration of the blood takes place. As a rule, the right lung is slightly larger than the left and is divided into three lobes (an upper, a middle, and a lower or basal), while the left has two lobes (an upper and a lower or basal). Each lung is irregularly conical in shape, presenting a blunt upper extremity (the apex), a concave base following the curve of the diaphragm, an outer convex surface (costal surface), an inner or mediastinal surface (mediastinal surface), a thin and sharp anterior border, and a thick and rounded posterior border.
Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Lung Pathologic N Stage Eligibility Status
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the status of a patient's lung pathologic N stage in relation to clinical trial eligibility.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueDomain.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
